name: NewYorker
text: “I’m here, in the present, in a ravaged America, watching two men in England, 30 years in the past, who are tending a garden more than a century old—very gently, and with great care, coaxing it back to life,” @hels writes. https://t.co/0c3fx0R9NP

text: From Honest Abe to Killer Lincoln, revisionist biographers have given us countless perspectives on the Civil War President. Is there a version that’s true to his time and attuned to ours? https://t.co/pNARc7Itp5

text: Lincoln revisionism is not new: historians’ visions of the President have long been shaped by their own political landscapes and cultural contexts. Is there a version that’s true? https://t.co/y5LqxG3WOP
